title: C04-1036

sentences.text: We suggest a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures .

The new criterion -- meaning-entailing substitutability -- fits the needs of semantic-oriented NLP applications and can be evaluated directly -LRB- independent of an application -RRB- at a good level of human agreement .

Motivated by this semantic criterion we analyze the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors and its impact on word similarity results , proposing an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality .
Finally , a novel feature weighting and selection function is presented , which yields superior feature vectors and better word similarity performance .

Entity-a_new_goal_and_evaluation_criteri.label: a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures
aliases: a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures
Entity-a_new_goal_and_evaluation_criteri.description: The entity refers to a proposed standard called 'meaning-entailing substitutability' that serves as a new goal and evaluation criterion for assessing the effectiveness of word similarity measures in semantic-oriented natural language processing applications.

mentions.local_name: a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures

Entity-meaning-entailing_substitutabilit.label: meaning-entailing substitutability
Entity-meaning-entailing_substitutabilit.description: Meaning-entailing substitutability is a proposed evaluation criterion for word similarity measures that aligns with semantic-oriented natural language processing applications and allows for direct assessment with high human agreement.

Entity-objective_measure_for_evaluating_.label: objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality
aliases: an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality
objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality
Entity-objective_measure_for_evaluating_.description: An objective measure designed to assess the quality of feature vectors used in word similarity evaluations, based on a new semantic criterion that emphasizes meaning-entailing substitutability.

mentions.local_name: objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality
an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality

Entity-feature_vector_quality.label: feature vector quality
Entity-feature_vector_quality.description: Feature vector quality refers to an objective measure used to evaluate the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors in the context of word similarity measures, particularly in semantic-oriented NLP applications.

Entity-semantic_criterion.label: semantic criterion
Entity-semantic_criterion.description: The 'semantic criterion' refers to the evaluative standard of meaning-entailing substitutability used to assess the quality of word similarity measures in natural language processing.

Entity-novel_feature_weighting_and_selec.label: novel feature weighting and selection function
aliases: novel feature weighting and selection function
Entity-novel_feature_weighting_and_selec.description: The novel feature weighting and selection function is a newly proposed method designed to enhance the quality of feature vectors used in word similarity measures, ultimately improving performance in semantic-oriented natural language processing applications.

mentions.local_name: novel feature weighting and selection function

Entity-word_similarity_performance.label: word similarity performance
Entity-word_similarity_performance.description: The term 'word similarity performance' refers to the effectiveness of evaluating how closely related or similar words are based on their distributional feature vectors, particularly in the context of semantic-oriented natural language processing applications.

Entity-better_word_similarity_performanc.label: better word similarity performance
Entity-better_word_similarity_performanc.description: Better word similarity performance refers to the improved effectiveness of word similarity measures achieved through the use of superior feature vectors derived from a novel feature weighting and selection function.

Entity-feature_weighting_and_selection_f.label: feature weighting and selection function
aliases: a novel feature weighting and selection function
Entity-feature_weighting_and_selection_f.description: The feature weighting and selection function is a novel algorithm designed to enhance the quality of feature vectors in natural language processing by optimizing the selection and weighting of features to improve word similarity performance.

aliases: its impact on word similarity results
Entity-it_impact_on_word_similarity_resu.description: The term 'its impact on word similarity results' refers to the influence of the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors on the effectiveness and accuracy of measuring word similarity in natural language processing applications.

mentions.local_name: its impact on word similarity results

Entity-empirical_quality_of_distribution.label: empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors
aliases: empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors
the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors
Entity-empirical_quality_of_distribution.description: The empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors refers to the effectiveness and reliability of vector representations of words based on their distributional properties in language, which is analyzed in the context of their influence on word similarity measures.

the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors

Entity-word_similarity_measure.label: word similarity measures
Entity-word_similarity_measure.description: Word similarity measures are computational metrics used to quantify the degree of similarity between words based on various linguistic and contextual factors.

Entity-word_similarity_result.label: word similarity results
Entity-word_similarity_result.description: Word similarity results refer to the outcomes of assessments that quantify the degree of similarity between words based on various linguistic or computational criteria.

Entity-a_good_level_of_human_agreement.label: a good level of human agreement
aliases: a good level of human agreement
Entity-a_good_level_of_human_agreement.description: A good level of human agreement refers to the degree of consensus among human evaluators when assessing the quality of word similarity measures based on the proposed criterion of meaning-entailing substitutability.

mentions.local_name: a good level of human agreement

Entity-semantic-oriented_nlp_application.label: semantic-oriented NLP applications
Entity-semantic-oriented_nlp_application.description: Semantic-oriented NLP applications refer to natural language processing tasks that prioritize understanding and utilizing the meaning of words and their relationships, particularly in the context of evaluating word similarity through criteria like meaning-entailing substitutability.

Entity-goal.label: goal
Entity-goal.description: The term 'goal' refers to the proposed new objective for developing an evaluation criterion aimed at enhancing word similarity measures in semantic-oriented natural language processing applications.

Entity-empirical_quality.label: empirical quality
Entity-empirical_quality.description: The term 'empirical quality' refers to the measurable effectiveness and reliability of distributional word feature vectors in the context of evaluating their impact on word similarity results.

Entity-human_agreement.label: human agreement
Entity-human_agreement.description: Human agreement refers to the level of consensus achieved among human evaluators when assessing the quality of word similarity measures based on the proposed criterion of meaning-entailing substitutability.

Entity-superior_feature_vector.label: superior feature vectors
Entity-superior_feature_vector.description: Superior feature vectors refer to enhanced representations of words that are generated through a novel feature weighting and selection function, leading to improved performance in word similarity tasks within semantic-oriented natural language processing applications.

Entity-distributional_word_feature_vecto.label: distributional word feature vectors
Entity-distributional_word_feature_vecto.description: Distributional word feature vectors are numerical representations of words that capture their meanings and relationships based on their distributional properties in large text corpora, commonly used in natural language processing tasks.

Entity-feature_vector.label: feature vectors
Entity-feature_vector.description: Feature vectors are numerical representations of data points in a multi-dimensional space, commonly used in machine learning and natural language processing to capture the characteristics of objects or words.

Entity-evaluation_criterion.label: evaluation criterion
Entity-evaluation_criterion.description: An evaluation criterion is a standard or metric used to assess the quality or effectiveness of a particular process, method, or measurement in a systematic way.

Entity-criterion.label: criterion
Entity-criterion.description: A criterion is a standard or principle by which something is judged or evaluated, often used in the context of assessing performance or quality.

Entity-objective_measure.label: objective measure
Entity-objective_measure.description: An objective measure is a standardized evaluation metric or tool used to assess the quality or performance of a particular entity or process based on quantifiable data.

summary: We suggest a new goal and evaluation criterion for word similarity measures . The new criterion -- meaning-entailing substitutability -- fits the needs of semantic-oriented NLP applications and can be evaluated directly -LRB- independent of an application -RRB- at a good level of human agreement . Motivated by this semantic criterion we analyze the empirical quality of distributional word feature vectors and its impact on word similarity results , proposing an objective measure for evaluating feature vector quality . Finally , a novel feature weighting and selection function is presented , which yields superior feature vectors and better word similarity performance .

Predicate-is_part_of.label: is part of
Predicate-is_part_of.description: The predicate 'is part of' indicates a relationship where the subject is a component, element, or constituent of the object. This connection implies that the subject contributes to the overall structure, function, or meaning of the object, suggesting a hierarchical or integrative relationship between the two entities.

Predicate-is_evaluated_by.label: is evaluated by
Predicate-is_evaluated_by.description: The predicate 'is evaluated by' establishes a relationship where the subject is assessed or judged based on the criteria or standards represented by the object. This indicates that the object serves as a benchmark or framework through which the performance, effectiveness, or quality of the subject is determined.

Predicate-suggests.label: suggests
Predicate-suggests.description: The predicate 'suggests' indicates a relationship where the subject provides a recommendation, indication, or proposal that is relevant to the object. In this context, the subject implies or points towards the object as a potential course of action, consideration, or standard, thereby influencing the understanding or decision-making related to the object.

Predicate-fits_the_needs_of.label: fits the needs of
Predicate-fits_the_needs_of.description: The predicate 'fits the needs of' indicates a relationship where the subject is aligned with or satisfies the requirements, preferences, or objectives of the object. It suggests that the subject provides suitable solutions, functionalities, or characteristics that are beneficial or necessary for the effective operation or success of the object.

Predicate-can_be_evaluated_at.label: can be evaluated at
Predicate-can_be_evaluated_at.description: The predicate 'can be evaluated at' indicates the capability of the subject to be assessed or measured in relation to the criteria or standards represented by the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject's effectiveness, performance, or quality can be determined based on the benchmarks or levels defined by the object.

Predicate-fits.label: fits
Predicate-fits.description: The predicate 'fits' indicates a relationship where the subject is suitable, appropriate, or compatible with the object. It suggests that the characteristics or qualities of the subject align well with the requirements or nature of the object, thereby establishing a harmonious connection between the two.

Predicate-motivates.label: motivates
Predicate-motivates.description: The predicate 'motivates' indicates a relationship where the subject serves as a driving force or source of inspiration that encourages or influences the object. In this context, the subject is something that instigates interest, action, or development in the object, which represents a concept, outcome, or phenomenon that is affected or enhanced as a result of this motivation.

Predicate-impacts.label: impacts
Predicate-impacts.description: The predicate 'impacts' denotes a relationship where the subject exerts an influence or effect on the object, indicating that changes or characteristics of the subject can lead to variations or outcomes in the object. This connection suggests a directional flow of influence, where the state or quality of the subject has the potential to alter, enhance, or diminish the properties or results associated with the object.

Predicate-analyzes.label: analyzes
Predicate-analyzes.description: The predicate 'analyzes' denotes an action where the subject conducts a detailed examination or study of the object, aiming to understand its components, structure, or quality. This relationship implies that the subject seeks to derive insights or conclusions about the object through systematic investigation.

Predicate-proposes.label: proposes
Predicate-proposes.description: The predicate 'proposes' indicates a relationship where the subject puts forward a suggestion, idea, or plan, which is represented by the object. This connection implies that the subject is advocating for the adoption or consideration of the object as a potential solution, framework, or guideline in a particular context.

Predicate-yields.label: yields
Predicate-yields.description: The predicate 'yields' indicates a causal or productive relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject produces, generates, or results in the object. It implies that the action or process represented by the subject leads to the creation or emergence of the object, suggesting a transformation or outcome that is beneficial or desirable.

Predicate-serves_as.label: serves as
Predicate-serves_as.description: The predicate 'serves as' indicates a functional or role-based relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject fulfills a specific purpose or function that is represented by the object. It implies that the subject acts in a capacity that is equivalent to or aligned with the characteristics or implications of the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or category that falls under a more general or inclusive category represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the object encompasses a wider scope or range of concepts, of which the subject is a part, thereby facilitating a classification or categorization of ideas.
